data.name: S#arp Shooter
data.detailed_description:
Music and VR games go together like "the smell of napalm" and "the morning", but most VR games are set to one scene and song. Imagine an experience where you have multiple settings, a variety of enemies, and a music selection as large as your personal library.

Now imagine it has a catchy name, with a double pun inserted for good measure, and you get S#arp Shooter! A game for the HTC Vive and Oculus (Rift + Touch) where you are the star of your very own action film, complete with large mob sequences and the soundtrack you listened to while stuck in traffic to help imagine yourself elsewhere.

All weapons fire based on the music itself, and enemy spawns are scaled to match. You can earn headshots and aim to beat your personal high score, or play more casually and just enjoy letting the scene play itself out.

This game is currently in development, and while it has several levels and most of the core functionality already, the following features are planned for the future:

  • Song Leaderboards
  • Ability to play music from SoundCloud
  • Voice Recognition
  • More scenes, enemies, and guns

    It’s time to shoot our own new Virtual Realities!

data.short_description: Guns fire and enemies attack based on music you choose from your library in S#arp Shooter - a VR game where you are dropped into an action movie scene and must stylishly shoot your way out!

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS: Windows 7 SP1
  • Processor: Intel Core i5 4590 or AMD FX 8350
  • Memory: 4 GB RAM
  • Graphics: GeForce GTX 970 or AMD Radeon R9 290
  • DirectX: Version 10
  • Additional Notes: It's a VR game, so if you meet the minimum specs for PC VR, you're probably good.
